links.*: The Lost Road and Other Writings

wikitext.*:
'''ONO''' is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]]. 

'''ON/NO''' (or '''ONO/NŌ''') signifies "beget/be born". '''NŌ''' (or '''NO''') signifies "generation, people, folk, large group regarded as of common ancestry".<ref name=PE>{{PE|17}}, pp. 26, 168, 170-171 (root appearing as "ON/NO", "√ONO/NŌ", "NO; NŌ." and "√NŌ")</ref>

While '''ONO''' shortly is explained as signifying "beget, give birth to", a longer signification is given as "family, tribe or group having a common ancestry, the land or region in which they dwelt".<ref name=WJ>{{WJ|Quendi}}, pp. 387, 413 (root appears as "*ONO")</ref> The latter signification shows the blending with [[NDOR|NDOR/DORO]].<ref name=PE/><ref name=WJ/>

==Derivatives==

*Quenya: ''onta'' ("beget"); ''nosta'' ("be begotten"); ''onwe'', ''onna'' ("child")<ref name=PE/>

*blended with [[NDOR|NDOR/DORO]]
**[[Quenya]]: ''[[nóre|nóre, nōre]]''<ref name=PE/><ref name=WJ/>

==Other versions==

===NŌ-, ONO-===

In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']] appear the related roots NŌ- and ONO-, both signifying "beget". From these roots derive:<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, pp. 378-379</ref>

*NŌ-
**Quenya: ''[[nóre]]''; ''[[nossë|nosse]]''
**[[Noldorin]]: ''nûr'' ("race"); ''noss'' ("clan, family, house")

*NŌ-
*Quenya: ''onóro'' ("brother"), ''onóne'' ("sister")
**[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''wanūro''<ref name=VT46>{{VT|46a}}, pp. 6-7</ref>
**Noldorin: ''[[gwanur]]''

*ONO-
**Quenya: ''[[onta-]]''; ''onna'' ("creature"); ''ontaro'' ("begetter, parent"); ''ontaru''<ref name=VT46/> (parents)
**Noldorin: ''odhron'' ("parent"); ''ed-onna'' ("beget"); ''ûn'' ("creature")

===NŌ-===

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root NŌ-, signifying "become, be born".<ref name=PE12>{{PE|12}}, p. 66</ref>

===NŌ-, NOWO? (NONO?)===

Also in the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root NŌ-, NOWO? (NONO?), signifying "ahead, in front; after, of time; tomorrow" (one of the derivatives is [[Qenya]] ''nuo'' "tomorrow").<ref name=PE12/> [[Patrick H. Wynne]] therefore connects this early root to the late Quenya word ''[[noa]]'' ("tomorrow" or "yesterday").<ref>{{VT|49a}}, p. 34 (note 23)</ref>
